description: SQL constraint that is used to specify rules for data in a table,

constraint_type.description: Classification of the constraint, can be one of the following values: PRIMARY KEY, FOREIGN KEY, UNIQUE, CHECK

keys.description: Columns included in the key from the primary table

target_keys.description: Columns included in the key from a referenced table

enforced.description: Indicates whether the constraint is checked when inserting new rows to table or updating existing rows.

notes.description: Free form textual notes that a user can add

name: physical_constraint
